text: Ieoh Ming Pei (April 26, 1917 â€“ May 16, 2019) was a Chinese American architect. Pei was an important name in his field, with his buildings built all over the world. When he was a child, he learned basic knowledge about architecture from his father. ==Career== Pei made innovations in architecture, and won the Thomas Jefferson Memorial Medal for Architecture. He built the Allied Bank Tower in Dallas, Texas, as well as the Louvre Pyramid, which is the main entrance to the Louvre Museum in Paris. In 1983, Pei won the Pritzker Prize.Pritzker Architecture Prize, "I.M. Pei, 1983 Laureate"; retrieved 2013-3-27. ==Death== Pei died in the New York City borough of Manhattan on May 16, 2019.
